captions.text: -Yeah, mine are bigger.
-Barely.
-Let's see them.
Nice guns.
-Well, we're live.
-Hi.
-Hi.
-Are you ready?
-We're live.
-OK.

Hi, I'm Mindy from
Cute Girls Hairstyles,

and today, we're
going to do an updo

that I'm calling
twisted zigzag updo.

Geez, I almost couldn't
remember the name.

OK, we're going to take
a section of hair right
at the top part of her head.

And we are going to
begin twisting it
just slightly to the left.

Turn her so you can see
a little bit better.

Now I'm going to pick
up a piece of hair,

and I'm going to go over
that original strand,

and we're going to
twist them together.

And once we've twisted
down a little ways,

then you're going to cut
it across to the left side,

and we're going to pick
up another piece of hair--

to the right side--
sorry the right side.

Pick up another piece of here
and go over the top again
and twist it together.

And now we're going to
take that whole piece back

towards the left
so they lay nicely.

We're going to pick up
another piece of hair.

And this time, I
like from this point

on going underneath
better than over the top.

Don't ask me why it makes
a difference, but it does.
So we're just going to go under.

We're going to twist
them together again.

And we're going to take it
back across to the right.

And we're going to pick up
another section of hair.

We're going to go
under again right here.

So just those first two
are going to go to over,
and the rest will go under.

And then take it back
around to the left.

And you can see the
beginnings of our fun updo.

Pick up another piece of
hair-- I'll turn you a little

this way-- take
it up-- so you're

going underneath
the original twist.
Wrap it a couple times.

You can see she's got
layers in her hair,

so these might
start popping out.

And that's OK, because we'll
just fix them at the end.

Take it back around
to the right side.
Pick up a section of hair.

Can you guess what
we're going to do next?
Go under.
Twist them together.
Go back.
What side are we on now?
The left.
-The left.
-Sheesh.
Pick up another piece of hair.
Take it under.
Twist it together.
And then go back to the right.
Pick up hair underneath.
Twist them together.
Then go back to the left.

And you're just
going to continue

this on and on until you run out
of hair, which we are nearing

the end here--
couple more pieces.

I try to keep her
layers tucked in.
Go back to the right.
Pick up hair.

Like I said, if you
start having pop outs,
just don't worry about it.

It's nothing a
bobby pin can't fix.
When we're done, go back.

And I think this might
be our last piece.

I'm going to take it and
just kind of wrap it.

So I just followed the same
line we were doing before,
like zigzag, zigzag.

And then I'm going to
take that and tuck it up.

And I'm going to use one
of my Goody spin pins

here to grab a couple
of pieces of hair

and just twist them
in on either side.

And hopefully, we've got
it all secured nicely.

And then you can
go back and just

fix any of these little
endies that are happening out

like that, or what other
little spots do we have?

Now I'm going to
go-- just because I

want that to lay flat, I'm
going to take one little Bobby,
pin right there as well.

And I might do one-- let
me see from the front.

It looks pretty good-- I
might do one right there
and just hide it.
And there you have.

This is really a
fun, fairly easy updo

that's great for any prom,
or homecoming, or any event
like that.

You can see the back of
it, how pretty it looks.

And then if you have any little
flyaways or anything like that,

you can go ahead and add just
a little bit of hair spray
to help tuck those under.
Comb them in just a little bit.

And also, you can
use a toothbrush

and spray a little hairspray
on them if you want to as well.

And that helps comb
the flyaways down.
We hope you guys enjoy.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
